info.title: Kitsu API
info.description:
## Welcome to the Kitsu API specification ```Version: 0.20.70``` The Kitsu API allows to store and manage the data of your animation/VFX production. Through it you can link all the tools of your pipeline and make sure they are all synchronized. An easy to use Python client to access this API is available: [Python Kitsu Client documentation](https://gazu.cg-wire.com/) ## Authentication

Before you can use any of the endpoints outline below, you will have to get a JWT token to authorize your requests.

You will find the information to retrieve it in the [Zou documentation](https://zou.cg-wire.com/api/).

post.summary: Log in user by creating and registering auth tokens.
post.description: Login is based on email and password. If no user match given email and a destkop ID, it looks in matching the desktop ID with the one stored in database. It is useful for clients that run on desktop tools and that don't know user email.

get.summary: Log user out by revoking his auth tokens.
get.description: Once logged out, current user cannot access the API anymore.

get.summary: Returns information if the user is authenticated else it returns a 401
get.description: response.

post.summary: Allow a user to register himself to the service.
Allow the user to change his password.
post.description: Prior to modifying the password, it requires to give the current password (to make sure the user changing the password is not someone who stealed the session). The new password requires a confirmation to ensure that the user didn't make a mistake by typing his new password.

post.summary: Resource to allow a user to change his password when he forgets it.
post.description: It uses a classic scheme: a token is sent by email to the user. Then he can change his password.

put.summary: Resource to allow a user to change his password when he forgets it.
put.description: It uses a classic scheme: a token is sent by email to the user. Then he can change his password.

400.description: Invalid password Wrong or expired token Inactive user

get.summary: Tokens are considered as outdated every two weeks.
get.description: This route allows to make their lifetime long before they get outdated.

post.summary: Resource to allow a user to enable TOTP.

400.description: Invalid password Wrong or expired token Inactive user

put.summary: Resource to allow a user to pre-enable TOTP.

400.description: Invalid password Wrong or expired token Inactive user

delete.summary: Resource to allow a user to disable TOTP.

post.summary: Resource to allow a user to enable OTP by email.

400.description: Invalid password Wrong or expired token Inactive user

put.summary: Resource to allow a user to pre-enable OTP by email.

400.description: Invalid password Wrong or expired token Inactive user

delete.summary: Resource to allow a user to disable OTP by email.

400.description: Invalid password. Wrong or expired token. Inactive user. Wrong 2FA.

get.summary: Resource to send an OTP by email to user.

400.description: Invalid password Wrong or expired token Inactive user

put.summary: Resource to allow a user to generate new recovery codes.

400.description: Invalid password Wrong or expired token Inactive user

post.summary: Resource to allow a user to register a FIDO device.

400.description: Invalid password Wrong or expired token Inactive user

put.summary: Resource to allow a user to pre-register a FIDO device.

400.description: Invalid password Wrong or expired token Inactive user

delete.summary: Resource to allow a user to unregister a FIDO device.

400.description: Invalid password Wrong or expired token Inactive user Wrong 2FA

get.summary: Resource to get a challenge for a FIDO device.

post.summary: Resource to allow a user to login with SAML SSO.

302.description: Login successful, redirect to the home page.

get.summary: Resource to allow a user to login with SAML SSO.
Retrieve all asset types (entity types that are not shot, sequence or episode).
Retrieve given asset type.
Retrieve all entities that are not shot, sequence, episode, or edit.
get.description: Adds project name and asset type name.

get.summary: Retrieve all entities that are not shot, sequence, episode, or edit.
get.description: Adds project name and asset type name.

get.summary: Retrieve all entities that are not shot, sequence, episode, or edit.
get.description:
Adds project name and asset type name and all related tasks.
If episode_id is given as parameter, it returns assets not linked
to an episode and assets linked to given episode.

delete.summary: Delete given asset.

get.summary: Retrieve given asset.
Retrieve all assets linked to given asset.

200.description: All assets linked to given asset

get.summary: Retrieve all tasks related to given asset.

200.description: All tasks related to given asset

get.summary: Retrieve all task types of tasks related to given asset.

200.description: All task types of tasks related to given asset

get.summary: Retrieve the list of shots that cast given asset.

200.description: List of shots that cast given asset

put.summary: Modify the casting of given asset.

200.description: Modification of assets linked to given asset

get.summary: Retrieve the casting of a given asset.
Retrieve all shot asset instances linked to given asset.

200.description: All shot asset instances linked to given asset

get.summary: Retrieve all scene asset instances linked to given asset.

200.description: All scene asset instances linked to given asset

post.summary: Create an asset instance inside given asset.

201.description: Asset instance created inside given asset

get.summary: Retrieve all asset instances instantiated inside given asset.

200.description: All asset instances instantiated inside given asset

get.summary: Retrieve all assets for given project and asset type.

200.description: All assets for given project and asset type

post.summary: Create new asset with given parameters.

get.summary: Retrieve all asset types for given project.

200.description: All asset types for given project

get.summary: Retrieve all asset types of assets casted in given shot.

200.description: All asset types of assets casted in given shot

get.summary: Retrieve all assets for given project.

post.summary: Share or unshare a list of assets.
Share or unshare all assets (or a list of assets) for given project.
Share or unshare all assets for given project and asset type.

get.summary: Retrieve all shared assets used in project.

200.description: All shared assets used in project

get.summary: Retrieve all shared assets used in project episode.

200.description: All shared assets used in project episode

put.summary: Resource to allow the modification of assets linked to an entity.

200.description: Modification of assets linked to an entity

get.summary: Resource to retrieve the casting of a given entity.
Resource to retrieve the casting of assets from given asset type.

200.description: Casting of assets from given asset type

get.summary: Resource to retrieve the casting of episodes.
Resource to retrieve the casting of shots from given sequence.

200.description: Casting of shots from given sequence

get.summary: Resource to retrieve the casting of shots from given episode.

200.description: Casting for all shots from given episode.

get.summary: Resource to retrieve the casting of shots from all sequences of given
get.description: project.

200.description: Casting for all shots from given project.

get.summary: Retrieve all entity links related to given project.
get.description:
Results can be paginated using page and limit query parameters. If you
prefer a more accurate pagination, you can use and
cursor_created_at to get the next page.

200.description: All entity links related to given project

delete.summary: Delete given entity link.
delete.description: It's mainly used for synchronisation purpose.

post.summary: Create an asset instance on given scene.

201.description: Asset instances created on given scene

get.summary: Retrieve all asset instances linked to scene.

200.description: All asset instances linked to given scene

get.summary: Retrieve all camera instances linked to scene.

201.description: All camera instances linked to scene

post.summary: Add an asset instance to given shot.

201.description: Asset instance added to given shot

get.summary: Retrieve all asset instances linked to shot.

delete.summary: Remove an asset instance from given shot.

204.description: Asset instance removed from given shot

get.summary: Get chat details.

parameters.name: entity_id
parameters.description: ID of the entity related to the chat

post.summary: Create a new chat message.

parameters.name: entity_id
parameters.description: ID of the entity related to the chat

parameters.name: message
parameters.description: Message to send

parameters.name: files
parameters.description: Files to attach

get.summary: Get chat messages for an entity.

parameters.name: entity_id
parameters.description: ID of the entity related to the chat

delete.summary: Delete chat message.

parameters.name: entity_id
parameters.description: ID of the entity related to the chat

parameters.name: chat_message_id
parameters.description: ID of the chat message

get.summary: Get chat message.

parameters.name: entity_id
parameters.description: ID of the entity related to the chat

parameters.name: chat_message_id
parameters.description: ID of the chat message

post.summary: Acknowledge given comment.
post.description: If it's already acknowledged, remove acknowledgement.

post.summary: Reply to given comment.
post.description: Add comment to its replies list.

delete.summary: Delete attachment linked to a comment matching given ID.
Delete given comment reply.

get.summary: Download attachment file.

post.summary: Add given files to the comment entry as attachments.

201.description: Given files added to the comment entry as attachments

get.summary: Return all attachment files related to given project.

200.description: All attachment files related to given project

get.summary: Return all attachment files related to given task.

200.description: All attachment files related to given task

post.summary: Create a new comment for given task.
post.description: It requires a text, a task_status and a person as arguments. This way, comments keep history of status changes. When the comment is created, it updates the task status with given task status.

parameters.name: Comment
parameters.description: person ID, name, comment, revision and change status of task

post.summary: Create several comments at once.
post.description: Each comment requires a text, a task id, a task_status and a person as arguments. This way, comments keep history of status changes. When the comment is created, it updates the task status with given task status.

201.description: Given files added to the comment entry as attachments

parameters.name: Comment
parameters.description: person ID, name, comment, revision and change status of task

get.description: output file.

get.summary: Return last working files revision for each file name for given task.

200.description: Last working files revision for each file name for given task

post.summary: Create new working file.
post.description: A working file is a file used to produce output files. It is the file the CG artist is working on. It is versioned, tied to a task and a software and requires a comment each time it is created. A path is generated for each file created. The path format is defined in the file tree template file.

parameters.name: File
parameters.description: Name, mode, description, comment, person ID, software ID, revision and separator.

get.summary: Return last working files revision for each file name for given task.

200.description: Last working files revision for each file name for given task

post.summary: Generate a working file path from file tree template.
post.description: Generate file path based on several parameters: task, software, mode, revision and separator. Revision can be computed automatically as next revision if not given.

parameters.name: File
parameters.description: Name, software, mode, revision and separator.

post.summary: Create new output file linked to assets through an instance of this asset for a given shot.
post.description: Some output files are linked to assets through an instance of this asset for a given shot. Each time a CG artist is satisfied by what he did on a working file, he can create an output file that will be linked to a target instance. It keeps track of the working file at the origin of the output file. An output type is required for better categorization (textures, caches, ...). A task type can be set too to give the department related to the output file.

400.description: Given output file already exists Given person not found Given output type not found

parameters.name: File
parameters.description: Name, mode, output type ID, task type ID, person ID, working file ID, file status ID, comment, extension, representation, revision, number of elements and separator.

post.summary: Get next revision for given asset instance, output type, task type and name.

200.description: Next revision for given asset instance, output type, task type and name

parameters.name: File
parameters.description: Name, output type ID, task type ID.

200.description: Last revisions of output files for given instance grouped by output type and file name

200.description: All types of output generated for given instance and temporal_entity

get.summary: Get all output files for given asset instance and given output type.

post.summary: Generate an output file path from file tree template
post.description: Generate file path based on several parameters: asset instance, output type, task type, revision, mode, name and separator. Revision can be computed automatically as next revision in case no revision is given in parameter.

parameters.name: File
parameters.description: Asset instance, output type, task type, revision, mode, name and separator.

get.summary: Get all working files for a given entity and possibly a task and a name.

200.description: All working files for given entity and possibly a task and a name

post.summary: Create new output file linked to a given entity.
post.description: Output files are linked to entities. Each time a CG artist is satisfied by what he did on a working file, he can create an output file that will be linked to a target entity (an asset, a shot, a sequence, ...). It keeps track of the working file at the origin of the output file. An output type is required for better categorization (textures, caches, ...). A task type can be set too to give the department related to the output file. Revision is automatically set.

400.description: Given output file already exists Given person not found Given output type not found

parameters.name: File
parameters.description: Name, mode, output type ID, task type ID, person ID, working file ID, file status ID, comment, extension, representation, revision, number of elements and separator.

200.description: Next revision for given entity, output type, task type and name

put.summary: Allow to modify the annotations stored at the preview level.
put.description:
Modifications are applied via three fields:
* `annotations` to give all the annotations that need to be added.

* `updates` that list annotations that needs to be modified.

* `deletions` to list the IDs of annotations that needs to be removed.

JWT Authorization.name: Authorization
JWT Authorization.description:
Format in header: **Authorization: Bearer {token}**. 

 Value example: Bearer xxxxx.yyyyy.zzzzz
